entry.title: Flood Warning issued August 17 at 10:02AM EDT by NWS Wilmington NC
entry.summary:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in South Carolina...North Carolina...
Waccamaw River near Longs affecting Horry, Brunswick and Columbus Counties.
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Carolina...
Waccamaw River At Conway affecting Horry County.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Waccamaw River at Conway.
* WHEN...Until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Flooding worsens in Lees Landing, Riverfront South, Pitch Landing, and Savannah Bluff and along Waccamaw CIR, Riverside DR, Black Moss DR, Cypress Flat Court, Depot RD, New RD, Jackson Bluff RD, and in low areas along Gray Oak DR. Some of these areas may be inaccessible via road. Old Reaves Ferry RD may begin to flood.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM EDT Sunday the stage was 12.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 12.6 feet early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - weather.gov/safety/flood
entry.cap:areaDesc: Horry, SC

cap:parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE

entry.title: Flood Warning issued August 17 at 10:02AM EDT until August 20 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Wilmington NC
entry.summary:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in South Carolina...North Carolina...
Waccamaw River near Longs affecting Horry, Brunswick and Columbus Counties.
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Carolina...
Waccamaw River At Conway affecting Horry County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Waccamaw River near Longs.
* WHEN...Until Wednesday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Flooding may limit vehicle access near the river at the end of Big Gutter Lane and Doodle Hill Lane. Low spots on Red Bluff Road will begin to flood. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 17 at 9:59AM AST by NWS San Juan PR
entry.summary:
At 958 AM AST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Jobos, or near Guayama, moving northeast at 45 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects.
This strong thunderstorm will be near... Cayey around 1005 AM AST. Caguas around 1015 AM AST.
Other locations impacted by this storm include Yaurel, Central Aguirre, Parcelas La Milagrosa, G. L. Garcia, Pastos, Las Ochenta, La Plena, Parcelas Nuevas, Sumidero, and Jagual.

entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued August 17 at 8:51AM CDT until August 17 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Sioux Falls SD
entry.summary:
At 851 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 2 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.
SOURCE...Radar.
IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas.
Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Westbrook, Jeffers and Storden.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 17 at 8:42AM CDT by NWS Brownsville TX
entry.summary:
The combination of hot temperatures and humidity will produce heat index values up to 110 degrees for a few hours this afternoon. A few locations may briefly experience heat index values a degree or two above 110 degrees.
If spending time outside today, drink plenty of water, wear light weight and light colored clothing, and take frequent breaks from the heat. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles.

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued August 17 at 9:34AM EDT until August 18 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Cleveland OH
entry.summary:
* WHAT...High risk of rip currents expected.
* WHERE...In Ohio, Ottawa, Erie, Lorain, Cuyahoga, Lake and Ashtabula Lakeshore Counties. In Pennsylvania, Northern Erie County.
* WHEN...From 4 PM EDT this afternoon through Monday evening.
* IMPACTS...Wind and wave action will cause currents on the lakeshore. Swimmers should not enter the water. Currents can carry swimmers away from shore through a sand bar and along structures extending out into the lake.

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued August 17 at 8:52AM AST until August 18 at 6:00AM AST by NWS San Juan PR
entry.summary:
* WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 8 to 14 feet. For the HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK, life-threatening rip current.
* WHERE...For the HIGH SURF ADVISORY, the most vulnerable areas for high surf and beach erosion include Pinones along Road 187, Parcelas Suarez, Villas del Mar, and Villa Christiana in Loiza; Fortuna in Luquillo; Pueblo and Tamarindo in Aguadilla; Barrio Obrero, Pueblo and Jarealito in Arecibo; Las Boca in Barceloneta; Machuca in Manati; Puerto Nuevo in Vega Baja; Ocean Park in San Juan; and Barrio Espinal in Aguada. For the HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK along the north and east-facing beaches.
* WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory until 6 AM AST Monday. For the High Rip Current Risk until 6 AM AST Monday.
* IMPACTS...FOR THE HIGH SURF ADVISORY, High waves that can wash over jetties and sweep people and pets onto jagged rocks. Rough surf may also knock you down. Large breaking waves will result in localized beach/dune structure erosion and dangerous swimming conditions. FOR THE HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK, rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water, where it becomes difficult to return to safety.
entry.cap:areaDesc: San Juan and Vicinity; Northeast; North Central; Northwest; Culebra; Vieques; St.Thomas...St. John.. and Adjacent Islands; St Croix

cap:parameter.value: HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AST MONDAY... ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AST MONDAY

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued August 17 at 7:11AM CDT until August 17 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Chicago IL
entry.summary:
* WHAT...Continued flooding caused by overnight excessive rainfall is expected. This Flood Advisory is replacing the Flash Flood Warning that has been in effect.
* WHERE...Portions of east central and northeast Illinois, including the following counties, in east central Illinois, Iroquois. In northeast Illinois, Grundy, Kankakee, Kendall and Will.
* WHEN...Until 1000 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Flooding may continue in poor drainage and urban areas. Roads and streets may still be flooded. High water likely may recede slowly from flooded areas. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 707 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated scattered heavy rain producing thunderstorms across portions of the advisory area. Radar and gauge estimates indicate that between 2 and 4 inches of rain fell overnight. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible over parts of the area. Runoff from the overnight rain and additional rainfall will result prolong the flooding in some locations. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kankakee, Bourbonnais, Yorkville, Bradley, Morris, Channahon, Minooka, Manteno, Braidwood, Wilmington, Coal City, Momence, Herscher, Clifton, Shorewood, Diamond, Elwood, Limestone and Gardner. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
entry.cap:areaDesc: Grundy, IL; Iroquois, IL; Kankakee, IL; Kendall, IL; Will, IL

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued August 17 at 5:25AM EDT until August 17 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Northern Indiana
entry.summary:
* WHAT...Dangerous swimming conditions expected, especially by late afternoon as winds shift to the north.
*Waves of 1 to 2 feet will build to 3 to 4 feet through the day.
*Life-threatening rip and structural currents are expected. Structural currents will be especially strong on the north side of piers and breakwalls.
*A strong southward flowing longshore current is expected by the afternoon.
* WHERE...In Indiana, Northern La Porte county. In Michigan, Southern Berrien county.
* WHEN...From noon EDT /11 AM CDT/ today through this evening.
* IMPACTS...Strong currents can pull swimmers into deeper water and high waves can sweep people off piers.
ADDITIONAL INFORMATION...
Strong thunderstorms over Lake Michigan overnight into this morning led to water level fluctuations at nearby gauges, suggesting seiche or meteotsunami activity was ongoing. This activity (largely unnoticeable visually) may persist through the evening, increasing the likelihood and strength of dangerous currents-even during periods of wave heights less than 3 feet.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northern La Porte; Southern Berrien
